meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Rick Cate Gaye Kapkin Bill Heins Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #1356.

td.p: Rick Cate, an assistant district attorney from San Antonio, Texas
Gaye Kapkin, an architect from Toronto, Ontario
Bill Heins, a graduate student originally from Whiting, Iowa (whose 1-day cash winnings total $4,300)

tr.td: AUTO-BIOGRAPHIES
COLORFUL PHRASES
1940s TELEVISION
THE HUMAN BODY
AMERICAN HISTORY
OFFICIAL STATE THINGS

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '(Gaye: Um, who is his wife , Cora King?)

Coretta Scott King

BillGaye
')

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Bill
Gaye
Rick

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Rick] We can\'t... not enough there, I don\'t think, is there, unfortunately.)
[As part of Rick\'s cross-out he had another letter that looked like an "O", though could have been heading towards a "G".]
RickWho is Woody Mark [start of T]
$1,800
GayeWho is Ben Franklin?
$3,000
BillWho is Mark Twain
$3,201
Mark Twain')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'He wrote: "They spell it Vinci & pronounce it Vinchy; foreigners always spell better than they pronounce"')

tr.td: AMERICAN AUTHORS
He wrote: "They spell it Vinci & pronounce it Vinchy; foreigners always spell better than they pronounce"
Bill
Gaye
Rick
2-day champion: $11,101
3rd place: "Pink Bonnet" lithograph by Adolf Sehring from American Artist Portfolio, Inc. + Nintendo Entertainment System with Family & Junior editions of Jeopardy! + Wheel of Fortune
2nd place: HeadStart III computer & Sebastian shopping spree
Bill
Gaye
Rick

18 R,
6 W
(including 1 DD)

12 R
(including 1 DD),
3 W

15 R,
5 W
(including 1 DD)

The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
